comment: DO NOT take her. A very harsh grader on the assigned essays, and the critiques don't make sense. She requires you to use the sources she provides to, but many are outdated and don't even work. Tedious assignments for a simple history class, and she barely replies to you. RUN!!

If you wanna gamble your grade then take this class. But in all honesty you'll probably end up with an A.
Don't watch the hour lectures she assigns, just ask AI to summarize it and use that. Same thing with the documents and literally everything in her class. I learned absolutely nothing and still got an A. Follow the rubric for the discussions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I wish I had more space to write about her. She doesn't create her own lectures, just utilizes other peoples stuff on youtube. She is extremely lazy and gave everyone in my class the same grade on the midterm. Didnt grade midterm until 2 days before grades we due and then accused me of AI on my final and my midterm 6 hours before grades we due....

If you're thinking about taking this professor…. don't! Doesn't put in grades until the very last minute, which is quite annoying bc it's hard to keep track of your grade. When it comes to an essay/final she's a very harsh grader and doesn't even give feedback to help you improve.

I took this professor at first since she had an 'ok' rating at her other school. Take her if you have no one else as her class is doable however I dropped since she is a slow grader and I knew I was not sure if I could get my grade up in time. Luckily I trusted my intuition since I saw how she muted her emails from all the other concerned students.

It is the end of the semester and I still have no idea who this professor is. As I write this review, I am watching all the grades from the entire semester populate in real time, three hours before the deadline. What a joke. Zero communication. Zero feedback on essays and midterms. I learned nothing in this course.
Essays had computer troubles and did not get back to me about

Can't believe KSU let people like her to teach in their institution.She doesn't feel responsible at all about the money that she is getting.Doesn't care about you. It is the end of the semester and I'm still waiting for the grade of the third week discussion. SHE NEEDS TO FEEL RESPONSIBLE ABOUT HER STUDENTS AND THE MONEY THAT SHE IS GETTING.

This class has 1 weekly discussion post with 2 required peer responses other than that there was the occasional essay + written midterm/final. The professor does not grade on time + gives no feedback. If u want a easy way to get ur history credit I would take this course but be willing to risk not knowing your grade in the class till the final week

Consistently behind in unlocking weekly materials and posted 1 announcement the entire semester. Dates in the syllabus occasionally did not line up with due dates in the course content. Entire semester of papers, midterms, discussion posts, everything graded in the last 2 weeks. Just a very lazy and unprofessional professor who can't be bothered.

Weekly modules containing discussions. First few modules had video lectures, but subsequent ones had links to lectures by other profs from other institutions. Two essays and two midterms. No feedback on grades. No communications. The few video lectures she had were excruciating to watch. Speaks with a lot of filler words and idioms.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: This class involves discussion every week but she doesn't put grades until the end of the semester, so you won't know how you're doing. Honestly, the classwork isn't as heavy but she's a tough grader and would put in zeros if she thinks you're using AI!!!! i DONT recommend taking her class if you're someone who keeps up with your grades.
Would not put grades in but you only had 1 disccusion every week. 1 midterm and 1 final. Easy history class
